Grades.Name: Excellent
Grades.Desc: Purpose of presentation is clear from the outset. Supporting ideas maintain clear focus on the topic.

Grades.Name: Good
Grades.Desc: Topic of the presentation is clear. Content generally supports the purpose.

Grades.Name: Fair
Grades.Desc: Presentation lacks clear direction. Big ideas not specifically identified.

Grades.Name: Poor
Grades.Desc: No focus at all. Audience cannot determine purpose of presentation.

Grades.Name: Excellent
Grades.Desc: Student presents information in logical, interesting sequence that audience follows

Grades.Name: Good
Grades.Desc: Student presents information in logical sequence that audience can follow

Grades.Name: Fair
Grades.Desc: Audience has difficulty following because student jumps around.

Grades.Name: Poor
Grades.Desc: Audience cannot understand because there is no sequence of information

Grades.Name: Excellent
Grades.Desc: Visual aids are readable, clear and professional looking, enhancing the message.

Grades.Name: Good
Grades.Desc: Visual aids are mostly readable, clear and professional looking.

Grades.Name: Fair
Grades.Desc: Significant problems with readability, clarity, professionalism of visual aids.

Grades.Name: Poor
Grades.Desc: Visual aids are all unreadable, unclear and/or unprofessional.

Grades.Name: Excellent
Grades.Desc: Speaker has prepared relevant questions for opening up the discussion and is able to stimulate discussion.

Grades.Name: Good
Grades.Desc: Speaker has prepared relevant questions for opening up the discussion and is somewhat able to stimulate discussion

Grades.Name: Fair
Grades.Desc: Speaker has prepared questions but is not really able to stimulate discussion

Grades.Name: Poor
Grades.Desc: Speaker has not prepared questions

Grades.Name: Excellent
Grades.Desc: Holds attention of entire audience with the use of direct eye contact, seldom looking at notes

Grades.Name: Good
Grades.Desc: Consistent use of direct eye contact with audience, but often returns to notes

Grades.Name: Fair
Grades.Desc: Displays minimal eye contact with audience, while reading mostly from the notes.

Grades.Name: Poor
Grades.Desc: No eye contact with audience; entire presentation is read from notes

Grades.Name: Excellent
Grades.Desc: Demonstrates a strong, positive feeling about topic during entire presentation.

Grades.Name: Good
Grades.Desc: Mostly shows positive feelings about topic.

Grades.Name: Fair
Grades.Desc: Shows some negativity toward topic presented.

Grades.Name: Poor
Grades.Desc: Shows no interest in topic presented.

Grades.Name: Excellent
Grades.Desc: Student uses a clear voice so that all audience members can hear presentation

Grades.Name: Good
Grades.Desc: Student's voice is clear. Most audience members can hear presentation.

Grades.Name: Fair
Grades.Desc: Student's voice is low. Audience has difficulty hearing presentation.Significant problems with readability, clarity, professionalism of visual aids.

Grades.Name: Poor
Grades.Desc: Student mumbles, speaks too quietly for a majority of audience to hear.

Grades.Name: Excellent
Grades.Desc: Demonstrate clear knowledge and understanding of the subject

Grades.Name: Good
Grades.Desc: Show clear knowledge and understanding of most subject area

Grades.Name: Fair
Grades.Desc: Show some knowledge and understanding of the subject area

Grades.Name: Poor
Grades.Desc: Show no knowledge and understanding of the subject area

Grades.Name: Excellent
Grades.Desc: Evidence of thorough research and preparation

Grades.Name: Good
Grades.Desc: Evidence of sufficient research and preparation

Grades.Name: Fair
Grades.Desc: Evidence of some research and preparation

Grades.Name: Poor
Grades.Desc: Evidence of no research and preparation

Grades.Name: Excellent
Grades.Desc: Demonstrate  thorough knowledge while discussing new ideas

Grades.Name: Good
Grades.Desc: Show  sufficient knowledge while discussing new ideas

Grades.Name: Fair
Grades.Desc: Show  some knowledge while discussing new ideas

Grades.Name: Poor
Grades.Desc: Show  no knowledge while discussing new ideas

Grades.Name: Excellent
Grades.Desc: Opinion set out in a concise and persuasive manner

Grades.Name: Good
Grades.Desc: Opinion is not concise and persuasive manner

Grades.Name: Fair
Grades.Desc: Opinion is clearly demonstrated but not persuasive

Grades.Name: Poor
Grades.Desc: Opinion is not demonstrated or highlighted

Grades.Name: Excellent
Grades.Desc: Responded very well to technical questions

Grades.Name: Good
Grades.Desc: Could answer most technical questions related to the presentation

Grades.Name: Fair
Grades.Desc: Could answer some technical questions related to the presentation

Grades.Name: Poor
Grades.Desc: Could not answer any technical questions related to the presentation
